title: Benigno Aquino III
summary: Benigno Simeon Cojuangco Aquino III (locally [bɛˈniɡnɔʔ aˈkino]; February 8, 1960 – June 24, 2021),[1][2] also known as Noynoy Aquino[3][4][5] and colloquially as PNoy,[lower-alpha 1] was a Filipino politician who served as the 15th president of the Philippines from 2010 to 2016.[9][10][11] Before being elected president, Aquino was a member of the House of Representatives and Senate from 1998 to 2010, and also served as a deputy speaker of the House of Representatives from 2004 to 2006.
